intro: Knautia illyrica f. montenegrina, commonly known as the Montenegro knautia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Montenegro. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh alpine conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and sturdy. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
